channel.title: Non-static variable playerId cannot be referenced from a static context - Wth?
channel.description:
Was adding agility, got an orphaned case, fixed it. Got 65 errors, fixed 63, now I have this...
So yeah.
Error... [code] client.java:58: non-static variable playerId cannot be referenced from a static context client c = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Player.playerId]; ^ client.java:64: addSkillXP(int,int) in client cannot be applied to (double,int) addSkillXP(EXPGained,16); ^ client.java:78: addSkillXP(int,int) in client cannot be applied to (double,int) addSkillXP(EXPGained,16); ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 3 errors Files Compiled Successfully! Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
Any help... Please...

item.title: Non-static variable playerId cannot be referenced from a static context - Wth?
item.dc:creator: @x0_0wn x0 0wn
item.description:
@x0_0wn wrote:

I have no idea what any of that is. :\

Would you mind explaining it to me please ?

Read full topic
item.source: Non-static variable playerId cannot be referenced from a static context - Wth?

item.title: Non-static variable playerId cannot be referenced from a static context - Wth?
item.dc:creator: @_Vengeance _Vengeance
item.description:
@_Vengeance wrote:

client.java:58: non-static variable playerId cannot be referenced from a static context client c = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Player.playerId]; ^ client.java:64: addSkillXP(int,int) in client cannot be applied to (double,int) addSkillXP(EXPGained,16); ^ client.java:78: addSkillXP(int,int) in client cannot be applied to (double,int) addSkillXP(EXPGained,16);

As the first one says, you are getting a non-static variable from a static method. Either make one static, or make the other dynamic.

For the second one, either cast it to a double or give it a double value to start with.

Read full topic

item.title: Non-static variable playerId cannot be referenced from a static context - Wth?
item.dc:creator: @Coder_Ryan Coder Ryan
item.description:
@Coder_Ryan wrote:

[quote="_Vengeance, post:12, topic:188037"][quote author=Reforced link=topic=250695.msg2100688#msg2100688 date=1205166791]
It means it needs a family

In other words, you need to add a bracket above it.

So since yours is case 2295

it’d look like this.

} case 2295:

Tell me if you get errors.
[/quote]

You’re stupid.[/quote]if your that smart? post help then??

Read full topic

item.source: Non-static variable playerId cannot be referenced from a static context - Wth?

item.title: Non-static variable playerId cannot be referenced from a static context - Wth?
item.dc:creator: @For For ( ; ; )
item.description:
@For wrote:

Orphaned case is a case that isn’t inside a switch statement.

ex of a good switch and cases -

switch(datatype) { //cases go here }

You have …

switch(datatype) { } //case here
That case needs to be moved inside a switch statement.

Read full topic

I’ve been trying since yesterday…
I’ve never had an orphaned case before…
